question_text: Select three key differences between RFID and NFC technologies:
answer_options: NFC supports two-way communication, RFID is usually one-way
RFID works only with mobile devices, NFC does not
RFID can be active or passive, NFC is typically passive
NFC has a much shorter range than RFID
NFC is used for data storage while RFID is not
correct_answer: NFC supports two-way communication, RFID is usually one-way
RFID can be active or passive, NFC is typically passive
NFC has a much shorter range than RFID
explanation: NFC builds on RFID, enabling two-way communication and very short range. RFID varies more in tag types and supported ranges.
